No individuals in captivity. Probably below the minimum viable population. 
The IUCN presumes extinction in the near future.[1]
Estimate is for mature individuals only.[3]
Estimates are for the wild population only; may reach as high as 500.[4]
Estimate is from 1993; numbers have probably shrunk.[20]

2500 is a maximum estimate from 1999, but recent work has shown numbers may 
be as high as 4000.[24]

Includes 1400 domestic animals and 1800 wild. Domestic numbers are likely 
underestimated.[25]

Estimate was made in 2002; wide-scale deforestation of their habitat began 
in 2003.[26]
Maximum estimate; may be less than 2000.[28]
6000 – 7000 in captivity and ~1000 in the wild.[36]

Maximum estimate; may be fewer than 5000. Numbers do not include the 
non-purebred domestic variety.[38]
Could be overestimated; may be less than 15 000.[55]
Was as low as 100 individuals in the 1800s.[57]

Minimum estimate, divided into three subspecies: Southern (33 000), 
Chanler's (2900), and Western (450).[62]
Numbers have increased from 20 – 24 000 in the 1970s.[65]
Numbers stood at 1 250 000 in the mid-1970s.[67]
Divided into two subspecies: Beisa (50 000) and Fringe-eared (17 000).[69]

Difficult to study due to the animal's nocturnal nature; numbers may be 
underestimated.[76]

Yet-to-be-published research suggests the population has been overestimated.
[88]
About 95 000 of the *Defassa* subspecies and 105 000 of the *Common*.[90]

Combined numbers of three subspecies: *Red* (98 000), *Kafue* (78 000), and 
*Black* (36 000).[91]

Includes 500 000 domestic animals and 30 000 wild (19 000 plains bison and 
11 000 wood bison).[106]

Numbered over 35 million in the early 1800s and as little as 20 000 in the 
early 1920s.[110]

Considered conservative. Divided into four subspecies: West African Savanna 
(27 000), Central African Savanna (133 000), Southern Savanna (670 000), & 
Forest (60 000).[113]
About 500 000 were hunted annually in Russia in the 1800s.[115]

Considered extremely conservative; yet-to-be-published research shows it 
may number as high as 10 000 000.[119]
